pullRequest.body:
* Rewrite (positive) cones in groups and rings to extend `Submonoid` and `Subsemiring`, respectively. This makes them easier to work with in applications.
* Add multiplicative versions of cones in groups.
* Add `nonneg` constructor for cones from ordered groups/rings.
* Weaken definition of cones in rings slightly (previous definition was nonstandard due to nonstandard definition of linearly ordered ring) -- to compensate, a new fact (ordered domain is strictly ordered domain) has been added.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [98ad82f726](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15975/commits/98ad82f72640493c77adfdbaa2b9c20bc234b3b1)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Ring.Cone | 218 | 595 | +377 (+172.94%) |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Group.Cone | 186 | 383 | +197 (+105.91%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Group.Cone`|197|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Ring.Cone`|377|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AddGroupCone`
`+ AddGroupConeClass`
`+ GroupCone`
`+ GroupCone.instGroupConeClass`
`+ GroupCone.instSetLike`
`+ GroupConeClass`
`+ IsMaxCone`
`+ IsMaxMulCone`
`+ LinearOrderedCommGroup.mkOfCone`
`+ LinearOrderedRing.mkOfCone`
`+ OrderedCommGroup.mkOfCone`
`+ OrderedRing.mkOfCone`
`+ OrderedRing.toStrictOrderedRing`
`+ RingCone`
`+ RingCone.instRingConeClass`
`+ RingCone.instSetLike`
`+ RingConeClass`
`+ coe_nonneg`
`+ coe_oneLE`
`+ mem_nonneg`
`+ mem_oneLE`
`+ nonneg`
`+ nonneg.isMaxCone`
`+ nonneg_toAddGroupCone`
`+ nonneg_toSubsemiring`
`+ oneLE`
`+ oneLE.isMaxMulCone`
`+ oneLE_toSubmonoid`
`- LinearOrderedRing.mkOfPositiveCone`
`- PositiveCone.one_pos`
`- StrictOrderedRing.mkOfPositiveCone`
`-- PositiveCone`
`-- TotalPositiveCone`
`-- mkOfPositiveCone`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

This PR slightly weakens the mathematical definition of a positive cone in a ring, to be in line with the standard definition, and to make it possible to view a positive cone as a subsemiring. The new definition is equivalent to `OrderedRing` rather than `StrictOrderedRing`. To compensate, I have added a new constructor for `StrictOrderedRing` when the underlying ring is a domain.
Not adding any more content to this PR -- should all work now.

> I am not a huge fan of the `AddCommGroup.PositiveCone`/`Ring.PositiveCone` naming convention. Do you think you could rename them to `PositiveGroupCone`/`PositiveRingCone`?

These names are getting absurdly long. Maybe GroupCone and RingCone? With Positive removed everywhere?

Also should I add a multiplicative version for groups? Is there a way to automatically go between them?

> Maybe GroupCone and RingCone? With Positive removed everywhere?

Yeah actually that sounds fine. As discussed in private, multiplicative would be nice to have but not necessary
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

> Thanks! Please remember to update the PR description to mention that you are defining `RingConeWithSquares`
> 
> maintainer merge

Where is my PR description? Is it just the very top comment?
I don't understand the error.
@YaelDillies could you help if you get a chance? I don't know what the missing docstring is.
Putting this on hold because there are a few definitions of cones kicking around and I want to get it right for applications the first time.
What about you make this PR do what it says on the tin? namely to rewrite the existing cone structures to use the subobject class pattern, and move the new content to a new PR?
Good idea! I will move the squares stuff and the new lemmas to a new PR.
I would particularly appreciate feedback on the new `IsMaxCone` design.

This looks like a much cleaner diff now.

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
I see that you add lots of transitive imports to reuse `Submonoid.nonneg`. Should we move these defs to new files?
I've opened #16381 to remove some imports to `Algebra.Order.Monoid.Submonoid`

> I see that you add lots of transitive imports to reuse `Submonoid.nonneg`. Should we move these defs to new files?

The remainder of the imports don't really seem worth eliminating: They are very basic algebra or very basic order theory which simply haven't been needed for cones yet because we don't have much theory.

:v: FM22 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10723405178/job/29736615853)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10723405178/job/29736616617)
bors d+
I am not a huge fan of the `AddCommGroup.PositiveCone`/`Ring.PositiveCone` naming convention. Do you think you could rename them to `PositiveGroupCone`/`PositiveRingCone`?

Thanks! Please remember to update the PR description to mention that you are defining `RingConeWithSquares`

maintainer merge
bors d+
This should be `PositiveCone.nonneg`
Sorry, I don't understand -- do you mean that I should rename the function?

```suggestion
/-- `PositiveConeClass S G` says that `S` is a type of positive cones in `G`. -/
```
to avoid confusing the mathlib type with the mathematical notion

```suggestion
  eq_zero_of_mem_of_neg_mem {C : S} {a : G} : a âˆˆ C â†’ -a âˆˆ C â†’ a = 0
```
if you want

```suggestion

This is equivalent to being the set of non-negative elements of some order on the group making it
into an  `OrderedAddCommGroup`. -/
```
Same here

```suggestion
theorem PositiveConeClass.neg_one_not_mem [Nontrivial R] [PositiveConeClass S R] : -1 âˆ‰ C :=
```

```suggestion
/-- `AddGroupConeClass S G` says that `S` is a type of cones in `G`. -/
class AddGroupConeClass (S G : Type*) [AddCommGroup G] [SetLike S G] extends
    AddSubmonoidClass S G : Prop where
  eq_zero_of_mem_of_neg_mem {C : S} {a : G} : a âˆˆ C â†’ -a âˆˆ C â†’ a = 0
  
@[to_additive]
/-- `GroupConeClass S G` says that `S` is a type of cones in `G`. -/
class GroupConeClass (S G : Type*) [CommGroup G] [SetLike S G] extends
    SubmonoidClass S G : Prop where
  eq_one_of_mem_of_inv_mem {C : S} {a : G} : a âˆˆ C â†’ aâ»Â¹ âˆˆ C â†’ a = 1
```

```suggestion
```
Same here
Can you extend `AddGroupCone` here too?
Done

```suggestion
In this file we provide the structure `GroupCone` and the predicate `IsMaxCone`
```
fixed
You only need `NoZeroDivisors Î±` here. Also, should it be a low priority instance?
Done the first part. @YaelDillies recommended to me to not make this an instance, due to potential for looping (if I understand right).
Please add a warning saying that using this as a constructor in an instance can lead to diamonds due to non-customizable `lt`, `decidableLT`, `decidableEq`, and `compare` fields.
Done -- does this also apply to the previous `def`?
Yes, certainly for the `lt`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Order): rewrite positive cones to use substructure pattern
